required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Neck Extension on Intraocular Pressure in Patients Undergoing Palatoplasty
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Neck Extension on Intraocular Pressure in Patients Undergoing Palatoplasty

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the change in intraocular pressure according to the neck extension during palatoplasty in pediatric patients.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at 5 minutes after the position change (neck extension)
primary_outcome.description: Intraocular pressure after neck extension during palatoplasty

secondary_outcome.measure: Intraocular pressure 10 minutes after anesthetic induction
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 10 minutes after anesthetic induction (supine position)
secondary_outcome.description: Intraocular pressure 10 minutes after anesthetic induction during palatoplasty

secondary_outcome.measure: Intraocular pressure at end of surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Intraocular pressure at end of surgery with neck extension

secondary_outcome.measure: Intraocular pressure 5 minutes after supine position
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 5 minutes after the position change to the supine position (after the end of the surgery)
secondary_outcome.description: Intraocular pressure 5 minutes after supine position

study_pop.textblock: Patients who have undergone a palatoplasty with cleft palate and who are 6 months or older and under 24 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have undergone a palatoplasty with cleft palate and who are 6 months or older and under 24 months
- Patients with ASA class 1-2
- Patients who agree to voluntarily participate in this study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who refused to participate in clinical studies
- History of diagnosis of neurologic or ophthalmic disease
- History of neurosurgery or ophthalmic surgery
